docs.text:
Welcome


Hello! My name is Jose and the goal of this website is follow my thesis development. Also, It will work as a fast guide to introduce and help student with the Robot Sawyer and ROS envioroment.  This work is taking in my semesters 2018 I - II. Where my personal computer-workstation has the following characteristics:








COMPONENT


DESCRIPTION










S.O.


Ubuntu 16.04






ROS


Kinetic






Processor


Intel® Core™ i7-7500U CPU @ 2.70GHz × 4






Dedicated


Solid State 100Gb






RAM


16 GB








The main idea of this work is built optimizate trajectories and  make automatic classification task. All information will be complementary with my personal github account. If you have some specify question write to: jose.avalos@utec.edu.pe


Official information could be find about the sawyer:
http://sdk.rethinkrobotics.com/intera/Main_Page


Regards!




Sources



    
Ayten, K. K., Sahinkaya, M. N., 
&
 Dumlu, A. (2016). Optimum trajectory generation for redundant/hyper-redundant manipulators. IFAC-PapersOnLine, 49(21), 493-500.
https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2405896316322637

    
Gasparetto, A., 
&
 Zanotto, V. (2010). Optimal trajectory planning for industrial robots. Advances in Engineering Software, 41(4), 548-556.
https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0965997809002464

    
Huang, J., Hu, P., Wu, K., 
&
 Zeng, M. (2018). Optimal time-jerk trajectory planning for industrial robots. Mechanism and Machine Theory, 121, 530-544.
https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0094114X17302914

    
Rubio, F., Llopis-Albert, C., Valero, F., 
&
 Suñer, J. L. (2016). Industrial robot efficient trajectory generation without collision through the evolution of the optimal trajectory. Robotics and Autonomous Systems, 86, 106-112. https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0921889015301998

docs.title: Sprint 1 [March 2018]

docs.text:
This section will explain my progress based in some specific work. This will be divide in weeks trying to follow the organization propouse in Thesis organization.


Conecction with the robot and variable envioroment




Week 1


The robot has been working with ROS envioroment which could access using terminala interace. However, in order to make automatic task is necesary to introduce them in a language program interface. Normally, ROS work overs some popular language as C++ and Python. Respect to the Sawyer robot this develop its libraries in Python interface. For that, we have to accomplish our task in this language.
docs.title: Session 1

However, in order to make automatic task is necesary to introduce them in a language program interface. Normally, ROS work overs some popular language as C++ and Python. Respect to the Sawyer robot this develop its libraries in Python interface. For that, we have to accomplish our task in this language.

docs.text:
Configure Ubuntu


1.-Install ROS


Official information could be find:




http://sdk.rethinkrobotics.com/intera/Main_Page


http://sdk.rethinkrobotics.com/intera/Workstation_Setup




We set the step in order to install ROS.


Setup your sources.list


sudo sh -c 'echo 
deb http://packages.ros.org/ros/ubuntu xenial main
 
 /etc/apt/sources.list.d/ros-latest.list'




Setup your keys


sudo apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://ha.pool.sks-keyservers.net:80 --recv-key 421C365BD9FF1F717815A3895523BAEEB01FA116




Update to Latest Software Lists


sudo apt-get update




Install ROS Kinetic Desktop Full


sudo apt-get install ros-kinetic-desktop-full




2.- Create Workspace


Directory name will depende of the user. Directory could change according to your preferences in my case will be 
avalos_ros_ws
.


mkdir -p ~/avalos_ros_ws/src
source /opt/ros/kinetic/setup.bash
cd ~/avalos_ros_ws
catkin_make




3.-Install INTERA Robot SDK


This git will contain the default software to use the robot.


cd ~/avalos_ros_ws/src
wstool init .
git clone https://github.com/RethinkRobotics/sawyer_robot.git
wstool merge sawyer_robot/sawyer_robot.rosinstall
wstool update




Build again


cd ~/avalos_ros_ws
catkin_make




4.-Add to Bash


In order to use 
roscd
 you have to add your directory to your bash file. Using Sublime :


subl ~/.bashrc 
-- add at the end
source /opt/ros/kinetic/setup.bash
source /home/jose/avalos_ros_ws/devel/setup.bash




To check you could try 
echo $ROS_PACKAGE_PATH
 in terminal.


5.- Define envioroment


We have to copy a default file wich contain the network connection information.


cp ~/avalos_ros_ws/src/intera_sdk/intera.sh ~/avalos_ros_ws




To edit the file I reccommed ~Sublime~ https://www.sublimetext.com/3


Change version in *.sh file


A important point is define the ROS version. In this work, it is kinectic


ros_version=
kinetic





In order to move fast to this directories, we define  :


test=/home/jose/avalos_ros_ws/src/intera_sdk/avalos_intera/scripts/test
avalos=/home/jose/avalos_ros_ws/src/intera_sdk/avalos_intera




AVADHI Conecction


This is used when the robot don't generate a IP. Refresh withouth close all envioroments. This is nedded to add for python msg


source ~/avalos_ros_ws/devel/setup.bash




In order to conect. We have to disable the internet


sudo avahi-autoipd  enp0s31f6




In another window open:


avahi-browse -a -r




Update intera version


There are no specific step to upgrade but in this case my action are based in the UTEC sawyer. The files had to be dowload in a USB from Intera foroum.


1.-Enter to boot interface


First of all, you need a keyboard to access to boot actions.

You have to connect it through the USB y keep press 
Ctrl+f
 after press boton ON.  When you see a regressive count (like 5,4,...) you have to keep press 
Crtl
 and press and depress 
f
. You have to wait until a white scree white red  
"Preparing to boot...
 , in this momento you have to press 
Ctrl+f
  to access to the menu.


[working]

docs.text:
Sawyer Hardware


Total information could be find:
http://sdk.rethinkrobotics.com/intera/Hardware_Components
The robot baxter have the following order. 


Joint and Link Names




Link Lengths




Range of Motion - Roll Joints




Range of Motion - Pitch Joints




Joint Limits


joint_names: [head_pan, right_j0, right_j1, right_j2, right_j3, right_j4, right_j5, right_j6]


position_lower: [-5.0952, -3.0503, -3.8095, -3.0426, -3.0439, -2.9761, -2.9761, -3.14]


position_upper: [0.9064, 3.0503, 2.2736, 3.0426, 3.0439, 2.9761, 2.9761, 3.14]


velocity: [1.8, 1.74, 1.328, 1.957, 1.957, 3.485, 3.485, 4.545]


accel: [10.0, 10.0, 8.0, 10.0, 10.0, 12.0, 12.0, 12.0]


effort: [8.0, 80.0, 80.0, 40.0, 40.0, 9.0, 9.0, 9.0]

docs.text:
Arm Control


http://sdk.rethinkrobotics.com/intera/Arm_Control_Systems


To control the limb, we must publish the JointCommand message on the topic:


robot/limb/right/joint_command




Example msg topic:


name: [head_pan, right_j0, right_j1, right_j2, right_j3, right_j4, right_j5, right_j6]

position: [0.0009954930312199295, -0.09533564475893463, 0.0013658189490914907, 0.003917532706931404, -1.649114553723206, -0.011475677835472986, -0.09970574050413106, 0.021091250273193474]

position: [0.000, -0.0953, 0.001, 0.003, -1.649, -0.011, -0.099, 0.0210]




JOINT FORMAT


Header header


int32 
mode  
           # Mode in which to command arm


string[]  
names 
       # Joint names order for command


Fields of commands indexed according to the Joint names vector.

Command fields required for a desired mode are listed in the comments


float64[] 
position 
    # (radians)       Required for POSITION_MODE and TRAJECTORY_MODE


float64[] 
velocity 
    # (radians/sec)   Required for VELOCITY_MODE and TRAJECTORY_MODE


float64[] 
acceleration
 # (radians/sec^2) Required for                   TRAJECTORY_MODE


float64[] 
effort
       # (newton-meters) Required for TORQUE_MODE


*Modes available to command arm
int32 POSITION_MODE=1


int32 VELOCITY_MODE=2


int32 TORQUE_MODE=3


int32 TRAJECTORY_MODE=4


Topics


[intera - http://localhost:11311] jose@avalos:~/avalos_ros_ws$ rostopic list




/clock


/gazebo/link_states


/gazebo/model_states


/gazebo/parameter_descriptions


/gazebo/parameter_updates

docs.text:
http://sdk.rethinkrobotics.com/intera/Arm_Control_Systems  To control the limb, we must publish the JointCommand message on the topic:  robot/limb/right/joint_command  Example msg topic:  name: [head_pan, right_j0, right_j1, right_j2, right_j3, right_j4, right_j5, right_j6]

position: [0.0009954930312199295, -0.09533564475893463, 0.0013658189490914907, 0.003917532706931404, -1.649114553723206, -0.011475677835472986, -0.09970574050413106, 0.021091250273193474]

position: [0.000, -0.0953, 0.001, 0.003, -1.649, -0.011, -0.099, 0.0210]
docs.title: Arm Control

docs.text:
Header header  int32  mode              # Mode in which to command arm  string[]   names         # Joint names order for command  Fields of commands indexed according to the Joint names vector. Command fields required for a desired mode are listed in the comments  float64[]  position      # (radians)       Required for POSITION_MODE and TRAJECTORY_MODE  float64[]  velocity      # (radians/sec)   Required for VELOCITY_MODE and TRAJECTORY_MODE  float64[]  acceleration  # (radians/sec^2) Required for                   TRAJECTORY_MODE  float64[]  effort        # (newton-meters) Required for TORQUE_MODE  *Modes available to command arm
int32 POSITION_MODE=1  int32 VELOCITY_MODE=2  int32 TORQUE_MODE=3  int32 TRAJECTORY_MODE=4
docs.title: JOINT FORMAT

docs.title: Topics

docs.text:
Motion


1.-Basic


Enable robot


rosrun intera_interface robot_enable.py




Random head move


from http://sdk.rethinkrobotics.com/intera/Head_Movement_Example


rosrun intera_examples head_wobbler.py




2.-Input/Output


Camera Image


rosrun intera_examples camera_display.py -c 'head_camera'
rosrun intera_examples camera_display.py -c 'right_hand_camera'




optional arguments:




-h, --help            show this help message and exit




-c {head_camera,right_hand_camera}, --camera {head_camera,right_hand_camera}
Setup Camera Name for Camera Display:






-r, --raw             Specify use of the raw image (unrectified) topic




-e, --edge            Streaming the Canny edge detection image




Image display


rosrun intera_examples head_display_image.py -f 
the path to image file to send





3.-Gripper


rosrun intera_examples gripper_keyboard.py






key: description,


'r': "reboot",


'c': "calibrate",


'q': "close",


'o': "open",


'u': "decrease position",


'i': "increase position",




INTERACTION CONTROL


Maybe best part of example.
http://sdk.rethinkrobotics.com/intera/Interaction_Control_Tutorial

docs.title: INTERACTION CONTROL

docs.text:
Simulator


The simultor is based in gazebo. This version is just working with 16.04


Total information could be find at:
http://sdk.rethinkrobotics.com/intera/Gazebo_Tutorial


Dependences


Open terminal 


sudo apt-get install gazebo7 ros-kinetic-qt-build ros-kinetic-gazebo-ros-control ros-kinetic-gazebo-ros-pkgs ros-kinetic-ros-control ros-kinetic-control-toolbox ros-kinetic-realtime-tools ros-kinetic-ros-controllers ros-kinetic-xacro python-wstool ros-kinetic-tf-conversions ros-kinetic-kdl-parser ros-kinetic-sns-ik-lib




Install sawyer_simulator


git clone https://github.com/RethinkRobotics/sawyer_simulator.git
cd ~/avalos_ros_ws/src
wstool init .
wstool merge sawyer_simulator/sawyer_simulator.rosinstall
wstool update




Build Source


source /opt/ros/kinetic/setup.bash
cd ~/ros_ws
catkin_make




Initialize Simulator


Before to acces be your to set your IP as your local IP. With 
ifconfig
is enough to get that information. 


cd ~/avalos_ros_ws/
./intera.sh sim




You have to change 
your_ip
 varibale to 127.0.0.1. You could acces to gazebo interface trhought the following command:


roslaunch sawyer_gazebo sawyer_world.launch
docs.title: Simulator

docs.text:
Links


My workplace is upload using github:


https://github.com/JoseAvalos/avalos_intera


Main official source is available in:


https://rethinkrobotics.github.io/intera_sdk_docs/5.1.0/index.html


Other links




http://rethinkrobotics.interaforum.com/


http://sdk.rethinkrobotics.com/intera/Community_Research


http://sdk.rethinkrobotics.com/intera/Running_Examples_Overview


http://sdk.rethinkrobotics.com/intera/Robot_Interface


http://sdk.rethinkrobotics.com/intera/API_Reference


http://sdk.rethinkrobotics.com/intera/SDK_System_Overview


http://sdk.rethinkrobotics.com/intera/Hardware_Components


http://sdk.rethinkrobotics.com/intera/Running_Examples_Overview




Info online:


*https://octave-online.net/#cmd=length(t1)


MOTION PLANING


Oficial Source


http://sdk.rethinkrobotics.com/intera/MoveIt_Tutorial
http://docs.ros.org/kinetic/api/moveit_tutorials/html/doc/move_group_python_interface/move_group_python_interface_tutorial.html


https://github.com/krishauser/Klampt


https://github.com/krishauser/Klampt/blob/master/Documentation/Tutorials/Install-Linux.md


The message:
http://docs.ros.org/melodic/api/moveit_msgs/html/msg/RobotTrajectory.html


type group:
http://docs.ros.org/jade/api/moveit_commander/html/move__group_8py_source.html#l00094


type msg:
http://docs.ros.org/jade/api/moveit_commander/html/classmoveitcommander_1_1movegroup_1_1MoveGroupCommander.html
http://docs.ros.org/jade/api/moveit_commander/html/classmoveitcommander_1_1movegroup_1_1MoveGroupCommander.html


FILES ORGANIZATION




2_trajectory.py : Send trajectory 


calculos : All joints data         


new_topic.py : suscriber topic to send to cloud   


test_head.py : ---


angulos.py : Inverse kinematic  


ik_service_client.py : --- 


record_data.py  : record data for joints(in progress)


trajectory.py : First try, no working




IOT


We have already decide to work with IBM Cloud. 


--
 Service name IIOT-UTEC


--
 Device type:robot-utec


--
Device id:sawyer-intera


auth-method = token
auth-token  = s4wyer-inter4


eventoutec
7dbnx
